newsitem.title: FRANCE: AIr Liquide rises on broker upgrade.
newsitem.headline: AIr Liquide rises on broker upgrade.

text.p: Shares in French industrial gases company Air Liquide rose on Monday after CCF Elysees Bourse upgraded it to "plus plus" from "plus", fund managers said.
The brokerage sees a target for the stock price at 1,000 francs, basing its view on the dollar's rise and scope for gains in the share which underperformed in 1996, the sources said.
Air Liquide's industrial investment programme last year weighed on margins and led to a rise of only 7.2 percent in 1996 compared to a climb of 23 percent for the CAC-40 index.
The stock was up 1.14 percent at 796 francs at 1230 GMT, while the market was up 0.67 percent.
